entry.title: St. Regis Hotel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in the 1980s, New York City's St. Regis Hotel (pictured) was said to have hosted every U.S. president since its opening?

entry.title: Gaddam Padmaja Reddy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that classical dances of Gaddam Padmaja Reddy, recipient of India's highest award for performing arts, explore contemporary social issues such as female foeticide and HIV/AIDS?

entry.title: Tomb of the Unknown Soldier (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier under the Arc de Triomphe in Paris was desecrated during riots in 1927?

entry.title: John Kinch (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that John Kinch worked two jobs in the late 1970s, as a mail carrier and a professional football player?

entry.title: Kitab al-wadih bi-l-haqq (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Kitab al-wadih bi-l-haqq is a critique of Islam written by a convert to Coptic Christianity during a period of persecution?

entry.title: Winton W. Marshall (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that fighter pilot Winton W. Marshall used the jet exhaust of his F-86 Sabre to extinguish the fire from a crashed B-47 bomber?

entry.title: fatally shot a Florida woman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a man who fatally shot a Florida woman waving a gun at him from her front yard after a road-rage incident was not charged in connection with her death?

entry.title: Zhu Zhenheng (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to Chinese physician Zhu Zhenheng, apparent possessions are typically no more than confusion caused by mucus?
